frame.name: Posture
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> supports their body in a particular <fen>Location</fen>. The LUs of the frame convey which body part is the <fen>Point_of_contact</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> is supported, what orientation the body is in, and some overall arrangement of the limbs (especially the legs) and the torso.
<ex><fex name="Agent">He</fex> <t>knelt</t> <fex name="Location">down</fex>, <fex name="Depictive">hand on heart</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the individual whose body is in a particular posture. The <fen>Agent</fen> FE is generally expressed as the external argument of verbs: <ex><fex name="Agent">Kim</fex> was <t>kneeling</t> by the window.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Location
FE.definition: <def-root>A description of the position of the <fen>Agent</fen>. The <fen>Location</fen> of the <fen>Agent</fen> is frequently expressed and generally occurs as a PP Complement: <ex>Kim was <t>kneeling</t> <fex name="Location">by the window</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen>'s state throughout the time they are in a particular posture. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). </def-root>

FE.name: Dependent_state
FE.definition: <def-root>A state of the Agent which crucially depends on their posture. <ex>She <t>sat</t> <fex name="Dependent_state">upright</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE indicates the Time interval during which the <fen>Agent</fen> held a certain posture.
<ex> <fex name="Time">Yesterday evening</fex> he was <t>sitting</t> in his armchair as usual</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Agent</fen> holds the posture.
<ex> Joel <t>sat</t> on the porch <fex name="Purpose">to watch the traffic go by</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The length of time for which the <fen>Agent</fen> holds the posture.
<ex> I could have <t>stood</t> there <fex name="Duration">all afternoon</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Point_of_contact
FE.definition:
<def-root>The part of the body that provides support to the <fen>Agent</fen>'s body in the posture.
<ex>I <t>stood</t> <fex name="poc">on my heels</fex> and looked out the window</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: bend.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be in a position in which one's body is folded, usually at the waist or the knees

lexUnit.name: crouch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be in a position where the knees are bent and the upper body is brought forward and down.

lexUnit.name: hunch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to sit or stand in a position in which one's shoulders and the top of one's body are bent forward

lexUnit.name: huddle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: curl one's body into a small space.

lexUnit.name: kneel.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fall or rest on a knee or the knees.

lexUnit.name: lean.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be in or move into a sloping position.

lexUnit.name: lie.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be in a horizontal position on a supporting surface

lexUnit.name: sit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: to be in a position in which one's weight is supported by one's buttocks rather than one's feet and one's back is upright.

lexUnit.name: slouch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stand, move, or sit in a lazy, drooping way.

lexUnit.name: sprawl.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: sit, lie, or fall with one's limbs spread out in an ungainly way.

lexUnit.name: squat.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be in a position low to the ground in which one's knees are bent and the heels close to or touching the buttocks or thighs.

lexUnit.name: stand.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be in or rise to an upright position, supported by one's feet.

lexUnit.name: stoop.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to bend one's body forwards and downward

lexUnit.name: bent.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: sharply curved or having an angle.

lexUnit.name: crouched.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: in a crouching posture.

lexUnit.name: huddled.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: having the limbs drawn in so that the body takes up little space.

lexUnit.name: hunched.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: with back and shoulders bent forward.

lexUnit.name: sprawled.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: with one's limbs spread out in an ungainly way

lexUnit.name: slouched.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: stand or sit in a lazy, drooping way with one's muscles extremely relaxed

lexUnit.name: seated.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: sitting

lexUnit.name: posture.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a particular position of the body.

lexUnit.name: stance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the way in which someone stands, especially when deliberately adopted.

lexUnit.name: position.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a way in which someone or something is placed or arranged.

lexUnit.name: cower.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to assume a posture that protects delicate organs from potential attack.

lexUnit.name: shrink.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: To reconfigure the body into a fetal position or into a smaller size.
